metadata.title: CVE-2023-3863 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in nfc_llcp_find_local innet/nfc/llcp_core.c in NFC in the Linux kernel. This flaw allows a localuser with special privileges to impact a kernel information leak issue.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3863` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-218-generic - 4.15.0-218.229
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-218-generic - 4.15.0-218.229
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-218-lowlatency - 4.15.0-218.229
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-164-generic - 5.4.0-164.181~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-164-lowlatency - 5.4.0-164.181~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1145-kvm - 4.15.0-1145.150
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-218.229').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4, was needs-triage').
